name: Kasundi
keywords: Kasundi, Indian condiment, Bengali mustard relish, tomato kasundi, spicy tomato chutney, mustard seed recipe, homemade kasundi, Indian sauce, spicy condiment, tomato relish, cumin, cayenne, turmeric, ginger, garlic, apple cider vinegar, birdseye chili, simmered sauce, easy kasundi recipe, vegetarian, gluten-free, chutney, relish
description: A flavorful Indian condiment, Kasundi, made from simmering tomatoes with mustard seeds, ginger, garlic, chili, and aromatic spices like cumin, turmeric, and cayenne. Creates a spicy, tangy relish perfect as a versatile sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Put a splash of neutral oil in a saucepan and add the spices, garlic and ginger. Fry slightly but don't let it burn.
recipeInstructions.name: Release spice flavors

recipeInstructions.text: Add the rest to pot and simmer. At this point, you can either blend the mix and continue to simmer down or you can just simmer down and let it be a bit chunky. Simmer down to a nice sauce and season with salt as desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer

notes: Amazingly tasty sauce that goes great with sausage rolls, pies, sausages, a bit of bread, on a sandwich, you name it!
